item.title: Diablo 4 Disables One of Season 10's Best Druid Aspects
item.description:
Diablo 4 recently disabled the Aspect of the Wildrage for Druids after unintended interactions allowed the class to dominate Season 10 with the companion build. Until Diablo 4 fixes these issues, characters will be unable to equip items that use this Aspect, and will gain no benefits if they were already wearing gear that uses it.

Season 10 of Diablo 4 officially began on September 23, bringing a fresh batch of content to the game. Among the various features in the update, Chaos Perks are some of the most exciting, as they allow fans to enhance their heroes with a new set of seasonal powers and upgrades to ascend their builds to extreme levels.

Diablo 4 Season 10 Druid Aspect of the Wildrage Disabled

Unfortunately, some Druid players may need to shift their Season 10 builds around for the time being. According to a forum post by Diablo 4 community manager filthierich, the Aspect of the Wildrage for Druids has been temporarily disabled until Blizzard resolves “a few interactions and issues.” Until then, items with this Aspect will not be equipable, and gear that is already worn with said Aspect will not grant Druids the associated ability.

The Aspect of the Wildrage grants a chance to activate a Companion skill every time another Companion skill is cast while also reducing its cooldown. While strong on its own, what likely led to this Druid Aspect in Diablo 4 Season 10 being disabled was the Raven skill, whose cooldown can be reduced to near-zero with Chaos Perks in conjunction with the new Kilt of Blackwing Druid Unique in Diablo 4 . Using this, Druids can spam Ravens to proc more powerful skills like that of the Poison Creeper, enabling them to outperform other classes and clear extremely high Pits.

At press time, it is unclear how long it will take Diablo 4 to reactivate the Aspect of the Wildrage. With luck, it could return within a day or two, but it could take longer as Blizzard figures out how to rebalance it while still preserving the popular Companion builds for Druids in Diablo 4 Season 10. It remains to be seen what this Aspect will look like after it returns.

In the meantime, gamers looking to try other effective builds in Diablo 4 might want to consider another class. The Shadowblight build for Necromancers in Diablo 4 Season 10 is especially potent and fun, as several Chaos Perks and Chaos Armors can help proc Shadow damage much faster. With tons of different powerful options in Season 10, Diablo 4 fans should have no trouble finding the build for them, even if the Ravens Druid gets hit with a substantial nerf.

110
7.5 /10
9 /10

Diablo 4

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Diablo® IV is the ultimate action-RPG experience with endless evil to slaughter, countless abilities to master, nightmarish dungeons, and legendary loot.

Embark on the epic campaign solo or with friends, meeting memorable characters through a gripping story in a beautifully dark world, or explore an expansive end game: battle iconic bosses for powerful loot, fight back the encroaching onslaught of Hell in Helltides, master the Forge to create your ultimate weapons and progress powerful characters, with cross-play and cross-progression on all available platforms.

Welcome to Hell

Discover the critically acclaimed franchise that defined the Action RPG genre. As the battle between the High Heavens and Burning Hells rages on, hatred devours Sanctuary as evil spreads and a new wave of cultists and worshippers arise to embrace Lilith’s coming. Only a brave few dare to face this threat and bring light to the all-consuming darkness.

Expansive Open World

Forge your own path through the corrupted lands of Sanctuary, an ever-growing, fully explorable world teeming with challenges, quests, enemies, and loot. Join your fellow adventurers, rescue and retake besieged towns, delve into nightmarish dungeons and uncover lost secrets as you fight back evil. The many zones of Sanctuary are yours to explore, and with rotating areas of extreme peril like World Bosses and Helltide, danger lurks at every turn.

Immersive Character Development

Create and customize your character to face the encroaching darkness. Choose from one of five classes and build your hero with skills, abilities and cosmetics, creating a champion that is uniquely your own. Grow stronger as you progress through powerful Skill Trees and develop even more unique end game specializations with Paragon Boards.

Legendary Gear, Epic Battles

Discover and experiment with a vast arsenal of powerful weapons, armor and more to fight back against the demons threatening Sanctuary. Explore unique combinations, create your own upgrades and collect a plethora of powerful tools to battle in immersive, action-packed combat against the deadliest of enemies.

Seasons & Events

The tales of Sanctuary continue to unfold. Create Seasonal Characters and join in fresh adventures - master new mechanics and take on the latest threats in each new Season. Complete harrowing feats of the Season Journey and earn new Battle Pass rewards. Plus, sharpen your swords and get in the spirit of the seasons when Limited-Time Events sweep through Sanctuary.

End Game Undertakings

There’s even more Diablo® IV to explore as you reach higher levels and more fearsome World Tiers. Face the greatest challenge yet as you take on the most powerful demons in The Pit, steel yourself against Uber Bosses to reap uber unique rewards, fight back overflowing armies of Hell as Helltides emerge across Sanctuary, battle larger-than-life World Bosses, and master the Forge to create the mightiest weapons fit for a hero.

item.title: Borderlands 4 Code Unlocks Free Rafa Skin
item.description:
Borderlands 4 is giving away the Savings Savior skin for Rafa, following the completion of the YOLT community challenge. This freebie offers a new incentive for Borderlands 4 players to check out Rafa, one of the new vault hunters introduced in the looter shooter franchise's latest title.

Starting with Borderlands 2 , released in 2012, Gearbox Software has been using its SHiFT rewards program to provide players with codes to unlock various freebies, ranging from in-game loot to character skins. In most cases, the SHiFT codes have given golden keys to players, which are crucial for unlocking golden chests containing valuables. A few days ago, a new community challenge in Borderlands 4 kicked off, with a brand-new Rafa skin revealed as its SHiFT code reward.

Borderlands 4 Rafa 'Savings Savior' Skin SHiFT Code

  • TZXT3-XJXCB-CXBJW-BTTJT-9SK6B

Borderlands 4 players can now claim the Savings Savior skin for Rafa using the code " TZXT3-XJXCB-CXBJW-BTTJT-9SK6B " via the in-game SHiFT menu or on the SHiFT website. As stated by the game's official Twitter account, this reward code, valid through December 31, 2030, was released after players "CRUSHED" the corresponding community challenge by getting 23.4 million second winds—3.4 million more than the required amount—as Rafa from September 26 to September 28. Inspired by his introduction video, titled "YOLT," the freshly revealed skin derives from the vault hunter's look in that clip and prominently bears the name of his former employer, Tediore, on the back. As a reminder, Borderlands 4 players must have created a SHiFT account and linked it to their platform before claiming this freebie.

The latest SHiFT code reward seems like an exciting one for fans of Borderlands 4 's Rafa, one of the most popular new characters included in the game. Besides giving him a change of appearance, the Savings Savior outfit also gives a nod to the exo-soldier's dark past in the military, offering a peek into his origins. The rawness of the outfit, captured by the blood stains on it, further gives Rafa a unique look that might attract those players who don't usually pick him in the first-person shooter title.

In the meantime, fans have been eagerly waiting for C4SH, an upcoming addition to Borderlands 4 's vault hunter lineup. It is the first of two vault hunters planned to roll out as part of their respective paid DLC. Announced at the Tokyo Game Show last week, the Mad Ellie and the Vault of the Damned story pack is scheduled for launch in Q1 2026. It will be interesting to see how the popularity rankings of the game's playable characters change after this DLC goes releases.

23

8 /10

item.title: Most Harrowing Open-World Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games like Pathologic 2 and Kenshi offer harrowing experiences without hand-holding.
  • Player deaths in these games lead to permanent debuffs, pushing them to learn and adapt quickly.
  • Survive hostile environments in games like Sons of the Forest and Subnautica with challenging gameplay.

Open-world games are usually easy to get into for most fans, especially since the vast majority of titles in this genre make it a point to be as welcoming as possible. However, this isn't a sentiment shared by every other game in the genre.

Some developers want to scare and challenge their players, leading to the development of genuinely harrowing open-world games that can be a nightmare to get into. Once players get a hang of things, they will find these games to be slightly less daunting to get into, although the tense feeling players have will take a while to fade away.

Pathologic 2

Death Can Arrive At A Moment's Notice And Lead To Permanent Debuffs

Pathologic 2
9.3 /10
Released
May 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Violence
Developer(s)
Ice-Pick Lodge
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
8 Images
Powered by

Pathologic 2 is one of the most fascinating open-world games players can get their hands on, with the unique setting of this title seeing players trying to figure out a way to combat the plague that's decimating a small town. However, this game, with its survival elements and tough combat, can be very harrowing to get through for players.

It's easy for players to die, but they'd want to avoid this by any means necessary since it leads to permanent debuffs that will hamper a player's run considerably. With enough deaths, players will be bogged down by so many penalties that they wouldn't mind missing out on an ending just to get rid of these negative effects.

Kenshi

A Savage World Where Players Are Unceremoniously Dropped Into With No Guidance

Kenshi
10 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Developer(s)
Lo-Fi Games
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Unlike most other open-world games players can get their hands on, Kenshi doesn't give players any objectives to follow or quests to complete. Players create a character, choose a background, and start their adventure in a random corner of the map based on their choice.

The unforgiving world of Kenshi will make it clear that grinding out combat stats and exploring the world with companions is a must if players don't want to suffer a humiliating death over and over again. Even after getting a grasp of the basics, Kenshi can be a nightmare to get through as players try not to become a product for slavers or monster food.

The Matchless Kungfu

The Open-World Sandbox Is Harrowing And Ruthless For Newcomers

The Matchless Kungfu
Sandbox
RPG
Systems
Released
November 6, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
HuanMos Game
Platform(s)
PC
5 Images
Powered by

Just like Kenshi , The Matchless Kungfu is another game where players carve out a story of their own instead of following a predetermined path. The world also expands in a unique way, with players being able to place blocks on the map to expand the world in their image as they make progress.

The complex turn-based combat and the weird rebirth system can take a while for players to wrap their heads around. Once they do, making progress in this wuxia-inspired open-world game is a blast, even if the difficulty doesn't let up.

Caves Of Qud

Players Will Die Over And Over Again Before They Finally Get A Hang Of Things

Caves Of Qud
Roguelike
RPG
Systems
Released
July 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Freehold Games
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Fans of classic ASCII roguelikes like NetHack will love what Caves of Qud brings to the table. Early on, it doesn't matter if players take on the role of a True Kin or a Mutant, since they're bound to die when they have no idea how this game works.

Each death serves as a learning experience before players can get over the initial difficulty curve. Once this is done, players can have a blast with Caves of Qud , although the difficulty remains consistent and reaches a fever pitch near the endgame when players have to deal with enemies that can potentially one-shot them if their build isn't good enough.

STALKER: Clear Sky

The Hardest Game In This Infamously Challenging Survival Horror Series

S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky
7.5 /10
Released
September 15, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
GSC Game World
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

In a series infamous for boasting some of the hardest open-world survival horror games players can get their hands on, Clear Sky is considered by many to be the most harrowing one of the lot. Most of this stems from a ridiculously hard early game where most players will drop the game before the world even opens up.

Once they deal with this early hurdle, the game becomes a classic STALKER experience with tense firefights and unique anomalies to discover. The game's difficulty adds to the sense of tension in this game as players strive to take as little damage as possible in combat encounters.

Sons Of The Forest

The Cannibals In This Game Are A Nightmare To Deal With

Sons of the Forest
8.6 /10
Released
February 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Endnight Games
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Sons of the Forest is an excellent sequel that improves upon almost everything from its predecessor. Trying to survive in a forest full of bloodthirsty cannibals makes for a harrowing experience, especially if players tackle this challenge alone.

A single mistake can lead to overeager players being mobbed by cannibals in no time. The sense of dread in this title, as players try not to mess things up, makes Sons of the Forest one of the most harrowing open-world games ever made.

Elden Ring

The Enemies In This Game Are Relentless And Punish The Smallest Mistakes

Elden Ring
10 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
6 Images
Powered by

Many FromSoftware veterans look at Elden Ring as what might be the easiest game made by this developer. However, new players unfamiliar with the company's patented gameplay loop will still find this open-world action RPG to be a pain to get into.

The Tarnished must explore the world and get stronger before dealing with the difficult hurdles standing in their way. The epic boss encounters of this game push players to the very limits, with players finding it hard to go somewhere else to gain more levels when they were so close to beating a particularly harrowing boss in yet another failed attempt.

Subnautica

The Thalassophobia Is Enough To Make Things Ultra-Harrowing For Players

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Subnautica is one of the best open-world survival games that players can get their hands on, but they shouldn't expect to have an easy time. Sure, the game is relaxing in its own way, but exploring an unknown ocean and dealing with the many underwater horrors that stand in their way is easier said than done.

Thalassophobic players have given this game a wide berth for the longest time, while players who didn't realize they feared the vast unknowns of the ocean will sing a different tune when they get ambushed by massive monstrosities over and over again.

item.title: The Sims 4: Adventure Awaits Release Time
item.description:
The Sims 4 has been out for over a decade, and during this time, dozens of DLC packs have been released in order to complement the base game. Many fans would agree that expansion packs are the most exciting packs for The Sims 4 , as they bring the most additional content to the table, greatly impacting gameplay and adding a significant number of Build Mode and CAS items.

The next expansion pack for The Sims 4 is called Adventure Awaits, and it focuses on childhood, imaginary friends, themed getaways, and custom venues. It will add a lot of possibilities in terms of gameplay and storylines, and greatly increase replay value for longtime fans. This guide will tell players all about the launch of the Adventure Awaits expansion pack so they can be sure not to miss it.

The Sims 4 Adventure Awaits Release Date & Time

According to the official launch page, The Sims 4 Adventure Awaits releases on Thursday, October 2, 2025, at 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET / 5 PM UTC . This is the same time as most The Sims 4 updates, so it is a schedule that most fans are already used to.

While waiting for the release of the Adventure Awaits EP, players should complete the Forever Friends Week 1 Quests. The event's objective is to incentivize players to try out the upcoming pack, so it features themed quests and rewards.

The Sims 4 Adventure Awaits Early Purchase Bonus

Besides the 157 CAS items and the 199 Build Mode items that are included with the expansion pack, gamers who get Adventure Awaits early on will also receive a bonus bundle.

Players who purchase Adventure Awaits before November 13, 2025, will receive the Warm & Cozy digital content bundle for The Sims 4 , which includes the following items:

  • Toasty Tower Lamp
  • Toasty Tootsies Socks
  • Toast-Tea Kettle

The digital bonus content will be available with Adventure Awaits on launch.

77

item.title: Dungeons and Dragons Players Boycotting Popular Map-Making Tool Over AI Controversy
item.description:
Inkarnate, one of the most popular Dungeons and Dragons map-making tools, is facing controversy about its intentions to allow AI art tools to be used while making products for its third-party market. While Inkarnate itself will not be using generative AI, this decision, along with several other recent policy changes, has caused many Dungeons and Dragons fans to boycott the map program.

When looking to create custom maps for their Dungeons and Dragons campaigns, many gamers turn to Inkarnate, one of the most popular tools available on the market. The basic functions of the browser program are available for free for all users, with additional functions available at a cheap subscription fee, including access to custom assets, commercial licenses, and more.

Players Threaten Boycott of Inkarnate Over AI Art Policies

Unfortunately, some recent policy decisions have landed Inkarnate in some hot water with fans. During a Q&A on one of the Champion-tier Early Access supporters channels of the Inkarnate Discord on September 24, CEO Ingmar confirmed intentions to allow artists to use generative AI to create assets on its third-party market. These products will allegedly be vetted to ensure quality and clearly labeled as using AI – and the company still has a zero-tolerance policy on genAI for assets provided by Inkarnate itself – but Ingmar believes consumers should be given the chance to “vote with their wallets,” rather than have the company ban the controversial tool outright. The conversation was collected and shared on the dndmaps Subreddit by MonstaMaps.

This Q&A was the culmination of several other controversies that had taken place a few days before. On September 19, Inkarnate more than doubled its subscription prices for new users overnight with little communication, though it honored existing members’ locked-in plans. By Monday, it rolled the price hike back in response to user backlash, only for Inkarnate to join the likes of Overwatch 2 by having an outsourced advertisement featuring AI art appear the day after, shared on the Inkarnate Reddit by GailenGigabyte.

Needless to say, fans were not happy about this series of events. Public outrage flooded the Reddit thread and other social media outlets with hundreds of comments from users and marketplace artists alike – and that is not even mentioning feedback from the Discord server. In response to this pushback, Inkarnate has stated that it is considering re-negotiating these terms, potentially resulting in a blanket ban of AI art in its marketplace. There have been no further developments at press time, so gamers will have to keep an eye out for further updates from Inkarnate to learn what move the troubled map-making tool will make next.
